Package ch.nolix.core.mathematics

Class Calculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.mathematics.Calculator

  • public final class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some mathematical functions. Most functions are provided in 2 different ways. -as normal functions that can be called with suitable arguments -as object that can be passed down

        public static final double DEFAULT_MAX_DEVIATION
        Is the default max deviation, that is 10^-9.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DOUBLE_AVERAGE

        public static IElementTakerElementGetter<java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Double>,java.lang.Double> DOUBLE_AVERAGE
        This function returns the average of its input values. This function throws an Exception if the given values are null or empty.

      • DOUBLE_MAX

        public static IElementTakerElementGetter<java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Double>,java.lang.Double> DOUBLE_MAX
        This function returns the maximum of its input values. This function throws an Exception if the given values are null or empty.

      • DOUBLE_MIN

        public static final IElementTakerElementGetter<java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Double>,java.lang.Double> DOUBLE_MIN
        This function returns the minimum of its input values.

      • DOUBLE_RANGE

        public static final IElementTakerElementGetter<java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Double>,java.lang.Double> DOUBLE_RANGE
        This function returns the range of its input values. The range of some values is the difference between the maximum and the minimum of the values.

      • DOUBLE_SQUARE

        public static final IElementTakerElementGetter<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> DOUBLE_SQUARE
        This function returns the square of its input value.

      • createFPNPairs

        public static List<FPNPair> createFPNPairs​(double[] xValues,
                                           double[] yValues)
        Creates list of FPN number from the given x-values and y-values.
        Parameters:
        xValues -
        yValues -
        Returns:
        a newly created list of FPN-pairs created from the given x-values and y-values
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if not as many x-values are given as y-values

                                            double maxDeviation)
        Parameters:
        value1 -
        value2 -
        maxDeviation -
        Returns:
        true if the given values equals approximately each other with a deviation that is not bigger than the given max deviation

        java.lang.Exception - if the given max deviation is negative
